title: How does Hakka's 6 tones sound like? - Quora

response.answer_text: It varies by dialect but the majority of them only vary so by a little bit. I am familiar with the sound of Hakka in Sichuan, and their tone contour can be considered one of the typical ones. It goes: 陰平 is pronounced mid-level (/˧/), sometime slightly rising. 陽平 is pronounced with a very low tone (/˩/) 上 is a falling tone (/˧˩/) 去 is pronounced with a very high tone (/˥/) 陰入 is low and short 陽入 is high and short
